item.title: Patapon 1+2 Replay Update Brings Boss Rush Mode
item.content:encoded:
Bandai Namco has released a brand new update for Patapon 1+2 Replay, and if you like to challenge yourself, then this one's for you.

As announced on Steam, the Boss Rush Challenge mode will see you taking on bosses from across both Patapon games included in the collection, and you'll have to clear the main scenario for each title if you want to try out its Boss Rush feature.

The number of bosses, as well as the strength of the bosses that appear, will vary from stage to stage, and your army's health and status will be retained throughout each stage, although a set amount of HP will be recovered from battle to battle.

When you clear Boss Rush stages, you'll return to how things were before you began, so you don't need to worry about any permanent changes; it's very much an additional mode that runs alongside your main adventures.

As announced on Bandai Namco's official X account, original Patapon designer Rolito is back on board, having provided new artwork specifically for the Boss Rush mode, so if you're a fan of the Patapon art style (and who isn't?), then you'll get a special kick out of this one too.

If you're unfamiliar with Patapon 1+2 Replay, it is, as the name suggests, a collection that includes remastered versions of the first two Patapon games, which were originally released on Sony's excellent PSP handheld.

The games are a sort of combination of rhythm-action and RPG in which you need to hit buttons in time with the (brilliant) music in order to advance your army and defeat a series of enemies. You can check out the Boss Rush update trailer, which shows off Patapon's gorgeous art style, right here.

Believe it or not, the Patapon revival doesn't stop with this collection, either; a spiritual successor, Ratatan, was released this year, and it's getting a massive update on Christmas Day as well, so you might want to check that out if you want more rhythm-action goodness.

You can check out Patapon 1+2 Replay right now on PC, PlayStation 5, and Nintendo Switch. Stay tuned for more.
